review.title: On model architecture for a children's speech recognition interactive dialog system
review.abstract: This report presents a general model of the architecture of information systems for the speech recognition of children. It presents a model of the speech data stream and how it works. The result of these studies and presented veins architectural model shows that research needs to be focused on acoustic-phonetic modeling in order to improve the quality of children's speech recognition and the sustainability of the systems to noise and changes in transmission environment. Another important aspect is the development of more accurate algorithms for modeling of spontaneous child speech.

sections.heading: 3. CONCLUSIONS
sections.text: The main advantage of the proposed model is its universality. This is due to the fact that the dialogue manager and the speech model are not dependent on the task to be performed. They are separate modules that can be updated independently of the system.In this report the following tasks were defined: The process of speech recognition was examined and presented, the specifics of the problem related to the speech recognition of children were analysed, an architectural model of a system for speech recognition of children was presented. Future work: A prototype of an information system based on the presented model to investigate the problems related to speech recognition of children up to 7 years of age. A linguistic adaptation of existing models is carried out in order to meet the limited vocabulary of children. • An adaptation of acoustic models and techniques is carried out to meet the specifics of language in children.
